snippet: Sales were below analysts’ expectations in May, but growth for April was revised higher, which helped keep growth forecasts intact.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that retail sales rose 0.3 percent in May, falling short of analyst expectations; April figure is revised upward to 0.5 percent, helping to keep growth forecasts intact; Labor Department reports that initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 4,000 to seasonally adjusted 317,000.
lead_paragraph: Sales were below analysts’ expectations in May, but growth for April was revised higher, which helped keep growth forecasts intact.

headline.main: Retail Sales Rose in May, but Slightly
headline.print_headline: Retail Sales Rose in May, but Slightly
